headline: The Best Hot Cross Buns Recipe to Make This Easter
keywords: hot cross buns recipe, easter recipes, easy easter recipes, easy hot cross bun recipe for easter
description: This is the best and easiest hot cross buns recipe to make for Easter. Plus learn the origins of hot cross buns and the reason behind the Easter tradition.
name: The Best Hot Cross Buns Recipe to Make This Easter
recipeIngredient: 1 c. milk, warmed to 110°F, plus 1 tablespoon, divided
2 1/4 c. all-purpose flour, spooned and leveled, plus more for work surface
2 c. bread flour, spooned and leveled
2 tbsp. candied lemon peel, cut into 1/4-inch pieces
2 tbsp. candied orange peel, cut into 1/4-inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dough: Coat a bowl with oil. Combine yeast, 1 cup milk, and 1 teaspoon granulated sugar in a second bowl. Let stand until foamy (if mixture doesn't foam, discard and start again). Combine all-purpose flour, bread flour, raisins, candied lemon peel, candied orange peel, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and remaining 3/4 cup granulated sugar in a third bowl. Beat with with a stand mixer, fitted with a dough hook, on low speed until combined.

Add butter, 2 whole eggs, and yeast mixture. Beat until a sticky dough forms, 2 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a lightly floured work surface and knead by hand until smooth, 4 to 6 minutes. Form dough into a ball, place in prepared bowl and turn to coat. Cover with a damp kitchen towel and let rise in a warm, draft-free place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.

Shape the buns: Line a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with parchment paper. Punch dough down and transfer to a lightly work floured surface. Knead for 3 minutes. Divide dough into 12 pieces, about 3 1/2 ounces each. Shape into balls and place, about 1 inch apart, in three rows of four in prepared baking dish. Cover and let rise until doubled in size and touch one another, about 1 hour 15 minutes.

Bake the buns: Preheat oven to 500°F with the rack in the lower third. Whisk together egg yolk and 1 tablespoon water in a bowl. Lightly brush on the top of each bun. Transfer to oven and reduce temperature to 400°F. Bake until golden brown, 18 to 20 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack; cool 5 minutes
Combine confectioners' sugar, vanilla, and remaining tablespoon milk in a bowl. Drizzle a horizontal line across each row of buns followed by a vertical line to form a cross on the crown.
